alert.note: Alert for Crawford; Dubois (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 03 at 5:29PM EDT by NWS Louisville
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 830 PM EDT/730 PM CDT/ THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of south central Indiana, including the following counties, Crawford, Dubois, Orange and Perry. * WHEN...Until 830 PM EDT /730 PM CDT/. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 529 PM EDT /429 PM CDT/, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Birdseye, Mentor, Schnellville, Riceville, Kyana and Wickliffe. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
